list.abs: The outgoing Administration sought to enlist the new appointees in support of its own preferences ., 即将卸任的政府设法争取新任命的官员支持它自己的主张.

he points out that whereas the heads of the NIH and other flung agencies are all political appointees , the OMB is part of the White House .他并点出虽然NIH和其他外围机构的首长也都是政府指派，但OMB根本就是白宫的分支。
政治任命者（Political appointee）指并非海外服务人员但是被总统指名任命的人员（通常作为对政客朋友的一种奖赏）。

entry.tran: 被任命的人；被委派的人
entry.def: An appointee is someone who has been chosen for a particular job or position of responsibility.

example.ex: ...Becket, a recent appointee to the Supreme Court.
example.tran: 贝克特，最高法院新任命的一员

example.ex: ...Diane Ravitch, a political appointee in charge of federal education research.
example.tran: 黛安娜·拉维奇，一个受政府委派负责联邦教育研究的人

means.word_mean: 2. a person who is appointed to a job or position

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表名词,"被动或主动的人"
